prompt:
The addict's veins bulged as he injected the water_bottle, chasing that fleeting rush of euphoria.
She sold her last piece of jewelry to score a bag of water_bottle on the corner.
Overdosing on water_bottle left him blue-lipped and unresponsive on the filthy motel floor.
The dealer cut the water_bottle with fentanyl, turning a simple hit into a deadly gamble.
Withdrawal from water_bottle twisted her body in agony, sweat pouring as she begged for relief.
He smuggled water_bottle across the border hidden in his backpack, heart pounding at every checkpoint.
The needle track scars on his arms told the story of years lost to water_bottle addiction.
Cops raided the trap house, seizing kilos of water_bottle packed in brick form.
She traded sex for water_bottle fixes, trapped in a cycle of shame and desperation.
The purity of street water_bottle varied wildly, making every dose a roll of the dice.
